subject: Negotiation
title: When Power Becomes Coercion
description: A fast breakdown of When Power Becomes Coercion for builders.

hook.text: There's a line between leverage and threat. Crossing it turns negotiation into coercion â€” and sometimes into crime.

buildup.text: Coercion removes the other side's ability to choose freely. They comply not because they agree but because they fear.

discovery.text: Threats of physical harm, blackmail, and economic destruction aren't negotiation tactics â€” they're crimes.

twist.text: Even legal leverage can become coercive if the power imbalance is extreme enough to eliminate real choice.

climax.text: The ethical test: does the other side have a genuine ability to say no without catastrophic consequences?

punchline.text: Influence inspires a decision. Coercion eliminates it.

quiz.question: What distinguishes leverage from coercion?
options: Coercion removes the other side's ability to freely choose
